Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.botstuff

Class MovementBot

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.botstuff.MovementBot
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bot
public abstract class MovementBot extends Object
This represents a simple bot with the Pinpoint Odometry Computer that can move. This is the basis of every future bot (unless if u dont want it to move lol). Leave this class as is unless you know what you're doing.

  • Field Details

    • opMode

      protected final com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode opMode
      This is necessary to exit blocking methods and to check whether the opMode is active.

    • botPose

      protected Pose2d botPose

    • targetPosition

      protected Pose2d targetPosition

    • lockPos

      protected Pose2d lockPos

    • currentFollowingRoute

      protected route currentFollowingRoute

    • curve

      protected BezierCurve curve
      This is the current Bezier Curve that the robot is following. All the bezier curve math is taken from Pedro Pathing.

    • follower

      protected PosePID follower
      PIDF controller for movement. Tune this.

    • PurePursuitFollower

      protected PosePID PurePursuitFollower
      PIDF controller for bezier curve following. Tune this.

  • Constructor Details

    • MovementBot

      public MovementBot(com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode opMode, Pose2d startPose, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap)
      Constructs a new MovementBot. Note that this class is abstract so you cannot directly do this. Delete abstract if you just have a chassis.
      Parameters:
      opMode - the OpMode that is using this object.
      startPose - where the robot starts on the field.
      hardwareMap - needed to actually be able to use motors.

  • Method Details

    • initRoute

      public void initRoute(routeNode... nodes)
      Initializes a route for the MovementBot to follow with as many or as few nodes as inputted.
      Parameters:
      nodes - the nodes of the route.

    • nextNode

      public void nextNode()
      Skips the current route's node.

    • getCurrentNode

      public routeNode getCurrentNode()
      Returns the current target node.
      Returns:
      the current node.

    • updatePos

      public void updatePos()
      VERY IMPORTANT! Updates the encoders and the odometry computer so the bot knows where it is.

    • setCurrentFollowingRoute

      public void setCurrentFollowingRoute(route route)
      Does same thing as initRoute(), but you can just input a route directly.
      Parameters:
      route - the route to be followed.

    • getOpMode

      public com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode getOpMode()

    • getBotPose

      public Pose2d getBotPose()
      Returns where the bot is. Be sure to call updatePos() before this or it will be inaccurate.
      Returns:
      Bot position

    • getFollower

      public PosePID getFollower()

    • setBezierCurve

      public void setBezierCurve(BezierCurve curve)
      Initializes a Bezier curve from Pedro Pathing for this MovementBot to follow.
      Parameters:
      curve -

    • moveTo

      @Deprecated public void moveTo(Pose2d position, PosePID pid)
      Deprecated.
      Old moveTo function that moves to any position on the field by taking translation and rotation separately (moves there first, then turns.) Old, bad, and deprecated, probably don't use this. Use tick() or tickBezier() instead.
      Parameters:
      position - where to move to
      pid -

    • moveTo

      @Deprecated public void moveTo(Pose2d position)
      Deprecated.
      Old moveTo function that moves to any position on the field by taking translation and rotation separately (moves there first, then turns.) Old, bad, and deprecated, probably don't use this. Use tick() or tickBezier() instead.
      Parameters:
      position - where to move to

    • moveToPlus

      @Deprecated public void moveToPlus(Pose2d position)
      Deprecated.
      Old (but less old) function that allows a bot to move to any coordinate on the field, moving and turning at the same time. Still not recommended for use, but it's not as bad as moveTo(). Use tick() or tickBezier() instead.
      Parameters:
      position - target position

    • distanceToTarget

      public double distanceToTarget()
      Returns how far away from the target you are.
      Returns:
      distance to target

    • tick

      public void tick() throws Exception
      This is one of the main methods you should be using. This method executes almost instantly, so it is recommended to put it in a while (opModeIsActive()) loop. Updates all of the robot's drivetrain to move towards the robot's target position and runs commands if there are any. Also automatically skips to the next node if possible. Halts the bot if it has no target.
      Throws:
      Exception - if this happens, idk what happened

    • tickBezier

      public void tickBezier() throws Exception
      This is one of the main methods you should be using. This method executes almost instantly, so it is recommended to put it in a while (opModeIsActive()) loop. Updates all of the robot's drivetrain to follow the robot's given Bezier curve and runs commands if there are any. Uses a Pure Pursuit algorithm to follow a curve. Currently in development.
      Throws:
      Exception - if this happens, idk what happened

    • getTargetPosition

      public Pose2d getTargetPosition(double curT, double lookaheadRadius)
      Pure Pursuit function that gets the closest pose2d on the curve that is at least lookaheadRadius away for the bot to follow.
      Parameters:
      curT - the t-value of where you are at on the curve
      lookaheadRadius - how far away the bot is searching for points
      Returns:
      the closest pose2d on the curve that is at least lookahead radius away

    • getTargetPositionT

      public double getTargetPositionT(double curT, double lookaheadRadius)
      you dont need to know what this does.
      Parameters:
      curT -
      lookaheadRadius -
      Returns:

    • getTickNum

      public long getTickNum()
      Gets the number of elapsed ticks.
      Returns:
      number of ticks

    • playerOverriding

      public boolean playerOverriding()
      A check if a player is overriding a waypoint movement. Can be changed to driver taste.
      Returns:
      if the human is interrupting

    • moveToPlus

      @Deprecated public void moveToPlus(Pose2d position, int msMax)
      Deprecated.
      Deprecated moveTo function. Read moveToPlus. This one quits if it takes more than msMax to get to the target. Don't use this unless you really want to. Use tick() or tickBezier() instead.
      Parameters:
      position -
      msMax -

    • inTolerance

      public boolean inTolerance()
      Returns if the bot is at its target position.
      Returns:
      is the bot at target position

      Deprecated.
      again, don't use this. this is deprecated. Use tick() or tickBezier() instead.
      Parameters:
      position -
      pid -

    • switchWaypoint

      public void switchWaypoint()

    • setWaypointPosition

      public void setWaypointPosition()
      Sets the current waypoint to where the bot is currently at.

    • moveToWaypoint

      public void moveToWaypoint()
      Moves to the selected waypoint. Working on having this not use the deprecated function.

    • turnTowardsFieldPoint

      public void turnTowardsFieldPoint(Pose2d coordinate)
      In progress. Triangulates the angle the bot has to be at to be facing a certain point and turns to it. Working on having this not use a deprecated function.
      Parameters:
      coordinate -

    • MecanumDrive

      public void MecanumDrive(double xPow, double yPow, double rotation, boolean isFieldCentric, boolean isLog)
      Basic Mecanum drive function that moves the bot with x, y, and rotation powers. Enable isFieldCentric unless a robot-centric driver is operating. Enable isLog if the driver wants slower driving for precise movements. Stops the bot and does nothing if movement is disabled.
      Parameters:
      xPow -
      yPow -
      rotation -
      isFieldCentric - should be true unless driver likes bot centric
      isLog -

    • MecanumDrive

      public void MecanumDrive(double xPow, double yPow, double rotation, boolean isFieldCentric, boolean isLog, boolean isHuman)
      Basic Mecanum drive function that moves the bot with x, y, and rotation powers. Enable isFieldCentric unless a robot-centric driver is operating. Enable isLog if the driver wants slower driving for precise movements. Stops the bot and does nothing if movement is disabled. Enable isHuman if it is being driver-operated.
      Parameters:
      xPow -
      yPow -
      rotation -
      isFieldCentric - should be true unless driver likes bot centric
      isLog -
      isHuman - Enable only if a human is driving the bot.
